Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2013 06:25PM jpkitte wrote: I had an ooph last August.  I started to swell right away uncontrollably.  I gained 20 lbs without eating much.  It was water retaintion.  I looked into this.  It looks like about 11% of people who had an ooph experience this.  I happened to be one of them, unfortunately.  Once my once priscribed Hydrochlorothiazode (water pill,) I started losing weight right away.  I lost 15 lbs in 4 days with a lot of big Ds, and lost the rest in a couple of weeks.  I have to be very careful taking this pill.  I can get violently ill if I lose too much water.  I'm hoping that my body will eventually adjust to this "menopause" and stop retaining water.  For now, I just have to keep taking it.  I just thought your case might be just like mine if you are gaining weight quickly.

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2012 11:16AM jpkitte wrote: I'm so sorry to hear what happened to you.  I've had a sprained ligament and a torn cartilage a few times.  I know how bad the pain is!  Did the docs in the ER say anything about fluid/blood in your knee?  I had blood in my knee.  When it was drained, the pain was down from unbearable to manageable.  If you can, try not to put any weight on your knee.  In my case, whenever I did that, the pain was always a lot worse the next day.  I hope your pain will go away soon.
